questions.title: Design a REST API for a Todo App
questions.prompt: Design REST endpoints for a Todo application (create, read, update, delete). Include request/response shapes at a high level.
followups: How do you handle validation and error responses?
How do you version this API?
How do you secure the endpoints?

questions.title: LRU Cache
questions.prompt: Implement an LRU cache supporting get and put in O(1) average time.
followups: Why do you need both a hash map and a linked list?
What edge cases would you test?
How would you make it thread-safe?

questions.title: Top K Frequent Elements
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers, return the k most frequent elements.
followups: Can you do better than sorting?
What is the time complexity?
How would you handle ties deterministically?

questions.title: Validate BST
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree, determine if it is a valid binary search tree.
followups: Why do bounds matter?
How would you do this iteratively?
What edge cases would you test?

questions.title: Lowest Common Ancestor
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree and two nodes, find their lowest common ancestor.
followups: How does this change for a BST?
What if one node is not present?
How do you avoid recursion depth issues?

questions.title: Detect Cycle in a Linked List
questions.prompt: Detect if a linked list has a cycle and return the node where the cycle begins (if any).
followups: Why does Floyd’s algorithm work?
Time and space complexity?
How would you test it?

questions.title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
questions.prompt: Search for a target in a rotated sorted array in O(log n) time.
followups: What invariant lets you keep logarithmic time?
What tricky edge cases exist?
How does duplicates change the solution?

questions.title: String Compression
questions.prompt: Compress a string by replacing repeated characters with the character followed by count. Return original if not shorter.
followups: What is the time complexity?
How would you handle very large inputs efficiently?
What test cases catch bugs?

questions.title: Concurrency: Producer-Consumer
questions.prompt: Explain how you would implement a producer-consumer system safely in a multi-threaded environment.
followups: How do you prevent deadlocks?
What are the trade-offs of bounded vs unbounded queues?
When would you use condition variables?

questions.title: Design a Logging Pipeline (High Level)
questions.prompt: Design a basic logging pipeline for a service: ingestion, storage, query, and retention.
followups: How do you handle high write volume?
How do you secure sensitive logs?
How do you design retention policies?

questions.title: Database Indexing Trade-offs
questions.prompt: Explain what a database index is and how it improves reads but can hurt writes. Give an example.
followups: What types of indexes do you know?
How do you choose what to index?
How do you measure whether an index helps?

questions.title: API Reliability and Retries
questions.prompt: Your service calls another service that sometimes fails. How do you design retries and timeouts safely?
followups: What is exponential backoff and why is it used?
How do you avoid retry storms?
When should you fail fast?

questions.title: Behavioral: Ownership
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you took ownership of a problem that wasn’t clearly assigned to you.
followups: How did you align stakeholders?
What trade-offs did you make?
What was the outcome?

questions.title: Behavioral: Conflict Resolution
questions.prompt: Describe a disagreement with a teammate about a technical decision. How did you handle it?
followups: How did you reach a decision?
What would you do differently next time?
How do you keep relationships strong during conflict?

questions.title: System Thinking: Feature Flag Rollout
questions.prompt: Explain how you would roll out a risky feature safely using feature flags.
followups: How do you monitor the rollout?
How do you rollback quickly?
What metrics would you track?

questions.title: Object Design: Shopping Cart
questions.prompt: Design classes/interfaces for a shopping cart system. Emphasize extensibility and testability.
followups: Where would you use interfaces and why?
How would you test pricing rules?
How do you avoid tight coupling?

questions.title: Implement Min Stack
questions.prompt: Design a stack that supports push, pop, top, and retrieving the minimum element in O(1).
followups: What extra data do you store?
How do duplicates of the minimum affect your solution?
Complexities?

questions.title: Design: Email Validator Service
questions.prompt: Design a service that validates emails (format, domain checks) with caching and rate limiting.
followups: What checks are safe to do synchronously?
How do you handle abuse?
How do you test it?

questions.title: Performance: Reduce Latency
questions.prompt: A web endpoint is slow. Describe how you would profile and reduce latency end-to-end.
followups: What do you measure first?
How do you differentiate CPU vs IO bottlenecks?
How do you prevent regressions?

questions.title: Why Microsoft (Engineering Focus)
questions.prompt: Why Microsoft? Connect your interests to Microsoft engineering culture (growth mindset, customer obsession, inclusive collaboration).
followups: What Microsoft product would you improve and why?
Tell me about a time you improved something based on user feedback.
How do you define impact?
